conclusion: To determine the amount of charge Q on the capacitor after it is fully charged and which plate is positively charged.
The metal rods rotate with an angular velocity ω = 600 rad/s.
The induced EMF in each rod is E = 1/2 B1 ω r^2 = 12 V.
The total EMF is E_total = 2 x 12 = 24 V.
The capacitor is connected across the tracks, and its capacitance is C = 0.09 F.
The charge Q on the capacitor is Q = C x E_total = 2.16 C.
The direction of the induced current in the ring is determined by Lenz's Law.
The magnetic field B1 is directed upwards.
The rotation of the rods induces a current that opposes the change in magnetic flux, implying the plate M is positively charged, and the plate N is negatively charged.
The amount of charge Q on the capacitor after it is fully charged is 2.16 C, and the plate M is positively charged.
